sections.name: GitHub Execution Layer Hardening
tasks: Add JSON_PATH override to create_issues.py so any domain JSON can be imported without editing the script
Verify PROJECT_STATUS override behavior and document the allowed Status values for Project #1
Implement a re-run safety mechanism that prevents duplicates without using GitHub Search API (e.g., a state file or GraphQL project-item check)
Add a docs/ folder for non-task reference material and keep data/*.json strictly for executable task imports
Add README instructions for running imports (DRY_RUN, JSON_PATH, PROJECT_STATUS) and avoiding duplicates
Define label standards and usage rules: tech vs tech-ai-specific vs social-media
Create project views/filters for Tech and Tech-AI-Specific (label-based) and verify cards appear correctly

sections.name: AI Brain Cleanup + Canonical Corpus
tasks: Inventory all current source locations for bot knowledge (Notion spaces, repo files, other vault locations)
Define a canonical corpus bundle structure for bot ingestion (SIR, governance summaries, GDP narrative, commons clarification)
De-duplicate the corpus bundle and separate drafts from canon
Create a repeatable export/sync step to regenerate the corpus bundle from Notion and/or repo sources
Enforce a volatile-content rule: keep phases/next-steps outside SIR and store them in Notion or a planning database
Update canonical corpus language to frame NEOS as a coordination overlay (not a replacement for legal authority)
Add Cosmos vs Nexus distinction into the canonical corpus and ensure it is referenced by bots
Add commons clarification + stewardship framing into the canonical corpus used by GDP + NEOS bots

sections.name: Bot Merge Workstream (GDP + NEOS)
tasks: Confirm SIR contains merge prerequisites (NEOS definition, commons clarification, stewardship framing, Cosmos vs Nexus distinction)
Build a unified context bundle for the merged bot: SIR + governance summaries + GDP narrative + commons clarification
Choose the merge approach: shared RAG corpus vs Notion-linked knowledge root (record decision + rationale)
Point both bots to the unified context bundle (knowledge-layer merge, not UI/persona merge)
Standardize a single Guide naming convention for the merged experience and apply across materials
Create a validation question set and run it against merged outputs (commons governance, ownership change, local choice, coercion framing)
Log known bot failure modes and patch the corpus bundle with approved additions

sections.name: Public Entry Flow Tech (Video → Bot → Form → Next)
tasks: Decide the minimal public entry stack components (video host, landing page, bot links, contact form, next-step routing)
Create/confirm a single landing page URL for small-circle testing (not public blast) linking: video + bots + contact form + orientation hub
Implement contact form capture (name/email/interest/skills) and define storage + notification routing
Create an intake-to-triage workflow (form submission → GitHub intake issue or inbox → weekly call queue)
Add a readiness toggle/note system for materials (private test vs share-by-link vs public) and apply it to the landing page

sections.name: CPS + Charting the Course Technical Coordination
tasks: Inventory CPS components in use now (Notion, Heartbeat, Symbi/SIMBI, website/landing) and document current state
Inventory Charting the Course assets and define what is active now vs planned later (system list, not SIR)
Define the merge path concept for CPS + Charting the Course into a unified profile/matching app (high-level architecture only)
Identify immediate integration points (links, shared profiles, shared onboarding pathways) without building the full app yet

sections.name: BEAM Bots Finish-to-Ready
tasks: Inventory existing BEAM bot assets (prompts, scoring logic, comparison flow outputs)
Create a finish-to-ready checklist for BEAM bots (what is missing, what must be tested, what is considered ready)
Package BEAM bot usage into a repeatable workflow (inputs, outputs, storage location, summary location)
Create a placeholder plan for BEAM 3 government-facing layer (registered, not active)

sections.name: Security + Ops
tasks: Define where secrets/tokens live (owners, rotation policy, and what can be stored where)
Create a token exposure response checklist (revoke, rotate, verify, document)
Document multi-sig requirements for keys/funds (now vs later) and where documentation lives
Add a rollback procedure for accidental issue floods (bulk close/label, prevention steps)

sections.name: Volunteer Tech Onboarding (Lightweight)
tasks: Create a 1-page GitHub orientation for non-technical contributors and link it from README
Create a proposal template for volunteers to claim tasks (scope, dependencies, resources needed, expected output)
Define a handoff standard (what gets summarized back to Notion vs what stays in GitHub vs what becomes canonical)
Create an onboarding checklist for new tech helpers (access, tools, where to ask questions, weekly call expectations)
